definition: root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Besides, Russia is also working on the localization of strategic missile research, development and manufacturing.
sentences.chinese: 此外，戰略導彈研發生產本土化也是俄努力的方向。

sentences.english: The next, cleared the definiens of culture localization and its meaning.
sentences.chinese: 其次，明確了文化本土化的含義及其意義。

sentences.english: Nativized Englishes are shown at various levels of the English language and distinct from each other.
sentences.chinese: 本土化英語表現在語言的各個層面，而且各不相同。

sentences.english: Chapter Four elaborates the Chinese Sinicized TBLT modes and structures.
sentences.chinese: 第四章探討了本土化任務型語言教學的模式結構。

sentences.english: We believe that these three perspectives will contribute to the nativization of English teaching in China.
sentences.chinese: 這三個視角有助於推動中國英語教學本土化的進程。

sentences.english: The nativization of psychology is now a problem of general concern in psychological circles.
sentences.chinese: 心理學本土化是心理學界當前普遍關心的一個問題。

sentences.english: The local phenomena of religious ritual is a very important issue in religious studies.
sentences.chinese: 宗教儀式的本土化現象是宗教學研究的主題。

sentences.english: Indigenization of law should be emphasized in legal construction in China.
sentences.chinese: 中國法制建設應重視法律的本土化問題。

sentences.english: The process of the localization of American traditional conflicts law has experienced two characteristic phases.
sentences.chinese: 美國衝突法的本土化經歷了特色鮮明的兩個階段。

sentences.english: "agenda-setting" theory, nationalization, content analysis, case study.
sentences.chinese: “議題設置”理論，本土化，內容分析，個案研究。

sentences.english: The rapid internationalization of English will inevitably result in its nativization.
sentences.chinese: 英語的迅速國際化必然引起英語廣泛的本土化。

sentences.english: During this period, Roman education had been completed independent and localization of the development.
sentences.chinese: 在這一時期，羅馬教育完成了自主化和本土化的發展。

sentences.english: A series of new words from new" Zhai" are produced in the process of localization in China.
sentences.chinese: “宅”詞新義在中國本土化後，出現了一批宅族詞。

sentences.english: And this paper can be considered as an alternative thinking of indigenization of the university education.
sentences.chinese: 本文可看成是大學教育本土化的另類思考。

sentences.english: Chen Xiaoming focused on the cultural study of the localization of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 陳曉明着重談了文化研究的本土化問題。

definition: to sinicize/to take on Chinese characteristics
the attitude of mechanically borrowing (ideas etc)
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
deep plowing/thorough penetration/thorough development (of a market segment etc)
